text: Fernando Fernández Gómez (28 August 1921 – 21 November 2007) better known as Fernando Fernán Gómez was a Peruvian-born Argentine-Spanish actor, screenwriter, movie director and theater director. He was a member of the Royal Spanish Academy for seven years. He won three Goya Awards for acting, one for directing and one for screenwriting. His best known directing work was Voyage to Nowhere. His best acting work was Mambru Went to War, The Grandfather and Belle Époque. Fernán Gómez died in Madrid, Spain on 21 November 2007 from heart failure caused by pneumonia and colon cancer at the age of 86. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2007 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Deaths from colorectal cancer Category:Writers from Lima Category:Argentine movie actors Category:Argentine stage actors Category:Argentine television actors Category:Argentine screenwriters Category:Argentine movie directors Category:Spanish movie actors Category:Spanish television actors Category:Spanish stage actors Category:Spanish screenwriters Category:Spanish movie directors Category:Spanish theatre directors Category:Actors from Madrid Category:Writers from Madrid Category:Goya Award winners Category:Actors from Lima
